member.name: M:Microsoft.Singularity.Loader.Binder.LoadImage(Microsoft.Singularity.Process,System.String!Microsoft.Contracts.NonNullType,Microsoft.Singularity.Loader.Manifest@)
member.summary: Loads the image of the corresponding application path has to be set to the actual path to the manifest (after resolution of symlinks)

member.name: T:Microsoft.Singularity.Loader.Manifest
member.summary: This is a placeholder class for an application's manifest. At present the application manifest is represented by a hashtable. The hashtable has several important properties: - name: the name of the application - path: path to the application executable

member.name: F:Microsoft.Singularity.Loader.Manifest.data
member.summary: We treat the application manifest as a collection of key, value pairs.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Singularity.Loader.Manifest.#ctor(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Create a manifest object from the given xml representation
